The default is `0.0`, and the range of valid values is `0.0` (completely dry) to `1.0` (completely wet). Only the [doc://com.apple.avfaudio/documentation/AVFAudio/AVAudioEnvironmentNode] class implements this property.

# reverbBlend

**Instance Property**

A value that controls the blend of dry and reverb processed audio.

## Declaration

```swift
var reverbBlend: Float { get set }
```

## Discussion

This property controls the amount of the source’s audio that the [doc://com.apple.avfaudio/documentation/AVFAudio/AVAudioEnvironmentNode] instance processes. A value of `0.5` results in an equal blend of dry and processed (wet) audio.

The default is `0.0`, and the range of valid values is `0.0` (completely dry) to `1.0` (completely wet). Only the [doc://com.apple.avfaudio/documentation/AVFAudio/AVAudioEnvironmentNode] class implements this property.

## Getting the 3D Mixing Parameters

- **obstruction**: A value that simulates filtering of the direct path of sound due to an obstacle.
- **occlusion**: A value that simulates filtering of the direct and reverb paths of sound due to an obstacle.
- **position**: The location of the source in the 3D environment.
- **rate**: A value that changes the playback rate of the input signal.
- **pointSourceInHeadMode**: The in-head mode for a point source.
- **sourceMode**: The source mode for the input bus of the audio environment node.
